docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
MCTennis is a spigot plugin to play tennis games in Minecraft.

Are you looking for the 6.x.x wiki? You can access it via the WayBackMachine.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Adds a new playable tennis lobby game or standalone minigame
  • A moving TennisBall without any resource pack
  • A customizable physic engine for the TennisBall
  • PlaceHolderApi Support
  • Multiple games per server
  • Player Stats collecting (Patreon Only)

docs.title: Api
docs.text: MCTennis offers a Developer Api, however it is not published to Maven Central or any other distribution system yet. You need to directly reference the MCTennis.jar file.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Add a dependency in your plugin.yml

softdepend: [ MCTennis ]

Take a look at the following example: 

public class YourPlugin extends JavaPlugin {
    @Override
    public void onEnable() {
        Player player = Bukkit.getPlayer("YourPlayerName");

        // Creating a tennis ball independent of a game.
        TennisBallFactory tennisBallFactory = Bukkit.getServicesManager().load(TennisBallFactory.class);
        TennisBall tennisBall = tennisBallFactory.createTennisBall(player.getLocation(), new TennisBallSettings());
        // The is no way to directly set the velocity, but you can kick it relative to the position the player.
        tennisBall.kickByPlayer(player);

        // Letting a player join a game.
        GameService gameService = Bukkit.getServicesManager().load(GameService.class);
        TennisGame game = gameService.getByName("myGameName");
        game.join(player, Team.BLUE);
    }
}

MCTennis broadcasts the following events.

docs.title: Bedrock
docs.text: MCTennis supports crossplay with Bedrock clients (SmartPhone,Windows,Console, etc.) using GeyserMC.

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text:
• Install GeyserMC on your server or on your proxy server.
  • Install MCTennis on your Spigot/Paper based server
  • Join your server with a BedRock client and join the MCTennis game /mctennis join game1.
  • Observe that the ball will be displayed as a simple player_head because bedrock does not support custom player heads.
  • Observe, that the ball will not be able to rotate.

docs.title: Fixing skin and rotations via GeyserMC (PatreonOnly)
docs.text:
Thanks to my Patreon supporters, who have funded this feature . They can download my prepared zip file to easily setup MCTennis for Bedrock.

If you are using the free version of MCTennis, you can still configure MCTennis for Bedrock, but it is more work for you. If you want to save time, become a patreon member at https://www.patreon.com/Shynixn.

Spigot/PaperProxies (BungeeCord, Velocity, etc.)
  • Download the MCTennis-GeyserMC.zip file from https://www.patreon.com/Shynixn.
  • Extract the MCTennis-GeyserMC.zip contents into your plugins\Geyser-Spigot.
  • Extract the custom-skulls_mctennis.yml into plugins\Geyser-Spigot\custom-skulls_mctennis.yml
  • Extract the packs/MCTennisPack.mcpack into plugins\Geyser-Spigot\packs\MCTennisPack.mcpack
  • Copy the player-profiles values from plugins\Geyser-Spigot\custom-skulls_mctennis.yml into the plugins\Geyser-Spigot\custom-skulls.yml file.
  • Download the MCTennis-GeyserMC.zip file from https://www.patreon.com/Shynixn.
  • Extract the MCTennis-GeyserMC.zip contents into your plugins\Geyser-<Proxy>.
  • Extract the custom-skulls_mctennis.yml into plugins\Geyser-<Proxy>\custom-skulls_mctennis.yml
  • Extract the packs/MCTennisPack.mcpack into plugins\Geyser-<Proxy>\packs\MCTennisPack.mcpack
  • Copy the player-profiles values from plugins\Geyser-<Proxy>\custom-skulls_mctennis.yml into the plugins\Geyser-<Proxy>\custom-skulls.yml file.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
The following commands are available in MCTennis. You can access them by typing:

/mctennis help 1

docs.title: /mctennis create
docs.text:
/mctennis create <name> <displayName>

Creates a new arena for a MCTennis game.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • DisplayName: Arbitrary Display for your game. Can contain ChatColors.

docs.title: /mctennis delete
docs.text:
/mctennis delete <name>

Deletes a MCTennis game.

  • Name: Identifier of a game

docs.title: /mctennis list
docs.text:
/mctennis list [player]

Lists all games you have created.

docs.title: /mctennis toggle
docs.text:
/mctennis toggle <name>

Enables or disables your game. If a game is disabled, nobody can join.

  • Name: Identifier of a game

docs.title: /mctennis join
docs.text:
/mctennis join <name> [team] [player]

Lets the player executing the command join the game. If no team is specified, a random team will be selected. If the player has already joined a game, this command can also be used to switch teams.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Team: Optional name of the team. Is red, blue or referee.
  • Player: Optional name of the player to join. Requires the mctennis.edit permission to use.

docs.title: /mctennis leave
docs.text:
/mctennis leave [player]

Lets the player executing the command leave the game.

  • Player: Optional name of the player to leave. Requires the mctennis.edit permission to use.

docs.title: /mctennis axe
docs.text:
/mctennis axe

Adds the MCTennis axe for selection to your inventory.

docs.title: /mctennis select
docs.text:
/mctennis select <name>

Sets a area for your arena.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Type: Type of selection to set: e.g. field, blue_goal, red_goal. See tab completion for all values.

docs.title: /mctennis location
docs.text:
/mctennis location <name>

Sets a location for your arena.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Type: Type of location to set: ball, red_spawnpoint, blue_spawnpoint, leave_spawnpoint

docs.title: /mctennis highlight
docs.text:
/mctennis highlight <name>

Starts highlighting your arena. When executing this command a second time, you stop highlighting an arena.

  • Name: Identifier of a game

docs.title: /mctennis inventory
docs.text:
/mctennis inventory <name> <team>

Copies the inventory of the player executing the command. This copy will be applied to players when they join a game.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Team: Name of the team. Is always red or blue.

docs.title: /mctennis armor
docs.text:
/mctennis armor <name> <team>

Copies the armor inventory of the player executing the command. This copy will be applied to players when they join a game.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Team: Name of the team. Is always red or blue.

docs.title: /mctennis gamerule
docs.text:
/mctennis gamerule <key> <name> <value>

Sets a gamerule of MCTennis.

  • Key: The name of the gamerule.
  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Value: Value of a gamerule. See tab completions for all values.

docs.title: /mctennis sign
docs.text:
/mctennis sign <name> <type>

Enables the player to add a specific sign by right-clicking any sign. You can remove signs by simply breaking the block.

  • Name: Identifier of a game
  • Type: Type of sign to create. Possible values: join, leave, team_red, team_blue

docs.title: /mctennis referee startgame
docs.text:
/mctennis referee startgame

Starts the lobby countdown of a game.

docs.title: /mctennis referee stop
docs.text:
/mctennis referee stop

Transitions the game to the final period. Executing this command again stops it.

docs.title: /mctennis referee setball
docs.text:
/mctennis referee setball [x] [y] [z] [yaw] [pitch] [world]

Teleports the ball to the position of the referee.

docs.title: /mctennis referee setballrel
docs.text:
/mctennis referee setballrel [forward] [sideward]

Teleports the ball to the relative position of the referee.

docs.title: /mctennis referee whistleresume
docs.text:
/mctennis referee whistleresume

Resumes the game and sets the ball interactable.

docs.title: /mctennis referee whistlestop
docs.text:
/mctennis referee whistlestop

Stops the game and sets the ball inactive.

docs.title: /mctennis referee freezetime
docs.text:
/mctennis referee freezetime

Freezes the countdown and sets the ball inactive.

docs.title: /mctennis referee nextperiod
docs.text:
/mctennis referee nextperiod

Transitions to the next configured period.

docs.title: /mctennis placeholder
docs.text:
/mctennis placeholder <placeholder>

Tries to resolve the value of a given placeholder.

  • PlaceHolder: PlaceHolder

docs.title: /mctennis reload
docs.text:
/mctennis reload [name]

Allows to reload all games or a specific single one.

  • Name: Optional identifier of a game

docs.title: Customization
docs.text:
This page explains how to customize a MCTennis game even further.

All customizations of a game are done by changing properties in your arena.yml file. If you have followed the previous guide, it is located under /plugins/MCTennis/arena/game1.yml.

Open the arena file in your favourite text editor (e.g. Notepad++) and take a look at the comments in the file. Edit the file and apply the changes to your game using the command /mctennis reload.

docs.title: Using CHAT-GPT to edit the arena file.
docs.text:
As there are tons of properties, you can actually use AI to easily edit the arena file without understand the structure.

You can find an example explained in the images below.

CHAT-GPT is able to directly edit the file and generate a download link. However, when testing it, the file structure was broken is some cases. Therefore, it is recommended that you apply the suggested changes of CHAT-GPT to the file yourself.

docs.title: Creating a new game
docs.text: This page explains step by step to setup a new game.

docs.title: Create a new game
docs.text:
Execute the following command to create a new arena file.

/mctennis create game1 My first game

docs.title: Confirm that the arena has been created
docs.text:
Execute the following command to list all games:

/mctennis list

Output:

game1 [My first game] [disabled]

You can see that the arena is still disabled and cannot be joined yet.

docs.title: Get the selection axe
docs.text:
Get the mctennis selection axe for selecting playing areas and goals.

/mctennis axe

docs.title: Enable highlighting
docs.text:
You can toggle highlighting important areas when editing your game. This makes it easier to edit them.

/mctennis highlight game1

docs.title: Setting the playing field
docs.text:
Select Point A with left-clicking using the MCTennis axe and Point B with right-clicking using the MCTennis axe. Then execute the command below.

/mctennis select game1 field

docs.title: Setting the area of team red
docs.text:
Select Point A with left-clicking using the MCTennis axe and Point B with right-clicking using the MCTennis axe. Then execute the command below.

/mctennis select game1 red_area

docs.title: Setting the area of team blue
docs.text:
Select Point A with left-clicking using the MCTennis axe and Point B with right-clicking using the MCTennis axe. Then execute the command below.

/mctennis select game1 blue_goal

docs.title: Setting the ball spawnpoint for team red
docs.text:
Move to the location where you want the ball to spawn. The current location of your player is used as a value when you execute the /mctennis location sub command. Execute the command below.

/mctennis location game1 red_ball

docs.title: Setting the ball spawnpoint for team blue
docs.text:
Move to the location where you want the ball to spawn. The current location of your player is used as a value when you execute the /mctennis location sub command. Execute the command below.

/mctennis location game1 blue_ball

docs.title: Enable the game
docs.text:
Once every location has been set, you can try to activate the game by executing the following:

/mctennis toggle game1

Confirm that the game is listed as enabled.

/mctennis list

Output:

game1 [My first game] [enabled]

You can join the game by running into the arena or executing the /mctennis join game1 command.

docs.title: Optional steps
docs.text: The following steps are not necessary but allow you to further customize the experience.

docs.title: Setting the leave-spawnpoint
docs.text:
Players can leave your game by running out of the field. However, you can also leave by typing /mctennis leave, which causes the player to be launched out of the forcefield. To avoid this, you should set a leaveSpawnpoint.

/mctennis location game1 leave_spawnpoint

docs.title: Setting the team-spawnpoints
docs.text:
Currently, players spawn at the location of the ball. You should also set individual team spawnpoints.

Disable the arena to be able to move into it.

/mctennis toggle game1

Move to the first location and execute:

/mctennis location game1 red_spawnpoint

Move to the second location and execute:

/mctennis location game1 blue_spawnpoint

docs.title: Converting the HUBGAME to a MINIGAME
docs.text:
• Currently, players can join and leave a game at any time. The timespan of a game is also infinity. In order to convert it to a standard Minecraft minigame, with a lobby and a max time, you should execute the following command.
  • If your arena has been enabled before, you may encounter and error message. You can ignore that because we will fix it in the next steps.
/mctennis gamerule gameType game1 minigame

docs.title: Setting the team-lobby-spawnpoints
docs.text:
Move to the lobby spawnpoints of your teams and execute the corresponding commands.

/mctennis location game1 red_lobby

/mctennis location game1 blue_lobby

docs.title: Enabling the game
docs.text:
If your game is disabled in the game list, you should now be able to enable it with the toggle command.

/mctennis list

/mctennis toggle game1

docs.title: Half-time, over-time, further customizations
docs.text: You can configure periods like half-times, breaks and overtimes in your game1.yml file. See the further customization section on the next page.

docs.title: Interactions
docs.text:
MCTennis offers settings regarding prohibiting commands, destroying blocks, setting certain gameMode, etc. to make it easier for you to customize the experience of your player.

However, you can further customize it by executing custom commands when a player joins or leaves the games.

arena.yml

joinCommands:
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/say Hello %mctennis_player_name% '
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/experience add %mctennis_player_name% 1'
leaveCommands:
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/say Bye %mctennis_player_name% '
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/experience add %mctennis_player_name% 1'

The type SERVER_PER_PLAYER executes commands using the SERVER level permission, which means players do not have to have the permission to the command. If you want to execute commands using the PLAYER level permission, use PER_PLAYER.

You need to configure this for each team. Each team can have its own join and leave commands.

docs.title: Permission Based Interactions
docs.text: The right way to prohibit certain commands and actions during games is to use a permission plugin to configure it. The most popular plugin LuckPerms can be used for that.

docs.title: Create a new group called mctennis
docs.text: /luckperms creategroup mctennis

docs.title: Add all your permissions you want to allow or not allow during games to this group
docs.text:
Important

Examples are permissions to certain commands, scoreboards or bossbar plugins. This allows displaying scores only during MCTennis games.

You can use the web editor or the following command. As long as the players are inside that group, they can only do (e.g. not break blocks) and see (e.g. scoreboards) what you have configured.

docs.title: Add a new join command which adds the player to the group while he is in the match
docs.text:
arena.yml

joinCommands:
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/lp user %mctennis_player_name% parent add mctennis'

docs.title: Add a new leave command which removes the player from the group when he quits the match
docs.text:
arena.yml

leaveCommands:
  - type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
    command: '/lp user %mctennis_player_name% parent remove mctennis'

docs.title: Set the player to certain states
docs.text:
For example, if you want to set the player to gamemode adventure during games, add another command called:

joinCommands:
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/lp user %mctennis_player_name% parent add mctennis'
- type: 'SERVER_PER_PLAYER'
  command: '/gamemode adventure %mctennis_player_name%

docs.title: Region Based Interactions
docs.text:
Another way to prohibit certain commands and actions during games is to use a region plugin to configure it.

Put a region around the arena and the lobby with certain flags to disable destroying the arena.

docs.title: Permission
docs.text: The following permissions are available in MCTennis.

docs.title: Levels
docs.text:
• User: A permission all players can have.
  • Admin/User: Depending on your server, you may give this permission to your players. If you are not sure, try to build your server around not giving this permission to your players.
  • Admin: A permission only admins should have.

docs.title: Recommended Permissions
docs.text: Permission Level Description mctennis.command User Allows to use the /mctennis command. mctennis.join.* User Allows to join all games. mctennis.shyscoreboard.scoreboard.* User Allows to see all mctennis scoreboards during games. mctennis.shybossbar.bossbar.* User Allows to see all mctennis bossbars during games.

docs.title: All Permissions
docs.text: Permission Level Description mctennis.command User Allows to use the /mctennis command. mctennis.join.* User Allows to join all games. The mctennis.command permission is also required. mctennis.join.[name] User Allows to join a specific game. The mctennis.command permission is also required. mctennis.command.staff Admin/User Allows to execute commands while ingame. This permission will be replaced in the future. mctennis.game.inventory Admin/User Allows open and click in inventories while ingame.   This permission will be replaced in the future. mctennis.edit Admin Allows to create, edit and delete games. mctennis.referee.join Admin Allows to manipulate games using /mctennis referee commands mctennis.shyscoreboard.scoreboard.* User Allows to see all scoreboards mctennis.shyscoreboard.scoreboard.[scoreboard-name] User Allows to see a specific scoreboard mctennis.shyscoreboard.command Admin Allows to use the /mctennisscoreboard command. mctennis.shyscoreboard.reload Admin Allows to reload configurations. mctennis.shyscoreboard.add Admin Allows to add a scoreboard to a player mctennis.shyscoreboard.set Admin Allows to set a scoreboard to a player mctennis.shyscoreboard.remove Admin Allows to remove a scoreboard from a player mctennis.shyscoreboard.update Admin Allows to refresh a scoreboard mctennis.shybossbar.bossbar.* User Allows to see all bossbars mctennis.shybossbar.bossbar.[bossbar-name] User Allows to see a specific bossbar mctennis.shybossbar.command Admin Allows to use the /mctennisbossbar command. mctennis.shybossbar.reload Admin Allows to reload configurations. mctennis.shybossbar.add Admin Allows to add a bossbar to a player mctennis.shybossbar.set Admin Allows to set a bossbar to a player mctennis.shybossbar.remove Admin Allows to remove a bossbar from a player mctennis.shybossbar.update Admin Allows to refresh a bossbar

docs.title: PlaceHolders
docs.text:
The following placeholders are available in MCTennis and can also be used via PlaceHolderApi.

PlaceHolder Api

As MCTennis supports multiple games per server, you need to specify the name of the game in external plugins. You can do this by appending the name of the game _game1 _mygame. This results into placeholders such as e.g. %mctennis_game_displayName_game1% or %mctennis_game_blueScore_mygame%. This is only relevant in external plugins. For placeholders in MCTennis, you can directly use the placeholders below.

Game Context Placeholders Description %mctennis_game_name% Id of the game %mctennis_game_displayName% DisplayName of the game %mctennis_game_maxPlayers% Max amount of players who can join this game %mctennis_game_players% Current amount of players in this game %mctennis_game_redDisplayName% Name of team red %mctennis_game_redScore% Score of the red team %mctennis_game_redPlayers% Amount of players who are currently in the red team %mctennis_game_redMaxPlayers% Max amount of players who can join the red team %mctennis_game_blueDisplayName% Name of team blue %mctennis_game_blueScore% Score of the blue team %mctennis_game_bluePlayers% Amount of players who are currently in the blue team %mctennis_game_blueMaxPlayers% Max amount of players who can join the blue team docs.title: Referee
docs.text:
MCTennis offers a third game mode called refereegame. This game mode is exclusive for Patreon supporters. (They are responsible for funding this feature ).

This game mode is intended for server events where you have an admin or moderator control the flow of a MCTennis match by using the /mctennis referee .... subcommands. Examples:

  • The referee can resume/pause matches
  • The referee can blow the whistle to block players interacting with the ball
  • The referee can place the ball anywhere
  • ...

docs.title: Create a new game with gamerule minigame first
docs.text: Go to the page https://shynixn.github.io/MCTennis/wiki/site/game/ and perform all steps until you have got a game with gamerule minigame.

docs.title: Setting the referee spawnpoint
docs.text:
Move to the location where you want the referee to spawn in the field.

/mctennis location game1 referee_spawnpoint

docs.title: Setting the referee lobby spawnpoint
docs.text:
Move to the location where you want the referee to spawn in the lobby.

/mctennis location game1 referee_lobby

docs.title: Converting the MINIGAME to a REFEREEGAME
docs.text:
In order to give the referee full control over the game, you need to convert the game type.

/mctennis gamerule gameType game1 refereegame

docs.title: Enabling the game
docs.text: /mctennis toggle game1

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text:
Players can join the game in the same way as before. However, the lobby countdown will not start until a referee has joined the game.

A referee can join the game using the following command:

/mctennis join game1 referee

docs.title: Starting the game
docs.text: /mctennis referee startgame

docs.title: Controlling the game
docs.text: The referee can control the game using the /mctennis referee... subcommands. You can take a look at the commands beforehand, but they are also displayed hints for the referee during the game.

docs.title: Setting up whistle sounds and clickable items
docs.text:
Currently, there is no way to directly add a whistle sound or execute the referee commands via items using MCTennis.

However, you can still do that by following these steps:

  • Install a third party plugin to bind commands to items (they are called Command Items plugins, use google)
  • Bind the referee commands /mctennis referee whistleresume and others to items
  • Bind the /playsound vanilla minecraft command to these items to play a whistle sound
  • Put the item in your inventory and execute the /mctennis inventory game1 referee command to put that item into the inventory, which is received by the referee on join.

docs.title: Signs
docs.text: This page explains how to create signs for joining and leave.

docs.title: Create a join sign
docs.text:
• Place a new sign in your world
  • Execute the following command:
/mctennis sign game1 join
  • Rightclick on a sign
  • This sign simply executes the /mctennis join command on behalf of the player. You can create team join signs by searching for the created sign in your game1.yml and editing the command to e.g. /mctennis join red

docs.title: Create a leave sign
docs.text:
• Place a new sign in your world
  • Execute the following command:
/mctennis sign game1 leave
  • Rightclick on a sign
  • This sign simply executes the /mctennis leave command on behalf of the player.

docs.title: Removing a sign
docs.text: • Simply destroy the sign with your hand
